Class DrawingPanel.DirectGif89Frame

java.lang.Object
  DrawingPanel.Gif89Frame
      DrawingPanel.DirectGif89Frame
Enclosing class:
DrawingPanel
 class DrawingPanel.DirectGif89Frame
extends DrawingPanel.Gif89Frame

Instances of this Gif89Frame subclass are constructed from RGB image info, either in the form of an Image object or a pixel array.

There is an important restriction to note. It is only permissible to add DirectGif89Frame objects to a Gif89Encoder constructed without an explicit color map. The GIF color table will be automatically generated from pixel information.

Version:
0.90 beta (15-Jul-2000)
Author:
J. M. G. Elliott (tep@jmge.net)
See Also:
DrawingPanel.Gif89Encoder, DrawingPanel.Gif89Frame, DrawingPanel.IndexGif89Frame

Construct an DirectGif89Frame from a Java image.

DirectGif89Frame

public DirectGif89Frame(int width,
                        int height,
                        int[] argb_pixels)
Construct an DirectGif89Frame from ARGB pixel data.

Parameters:
width - Width of the bitmap.
height - Height of the bitmap.
argb_pixels - Array containing at least width*height pixels in the format returned by java.awt.Color.getRGB().
